results.description: The Brooklyn neighborhood south of Greenwood Cemetery, north of Bay Ridge, and west of Borough Park is named for its eponymous park, which, looking westward, offers a magnificent view of the harbor. Once home to a thriving waterfront (under redevelopment), the polyglot neighborhood is now characterized by the city’s largest Chinatown, in the eastern part, and a Hispanic area just to its west. Be prepared to walk at least six miles to experience Sunset Park in all its variety, but there are convenient drop-off points. Meet 11 a.m. outside the 59th Street station on the N and R lines in Brooklyn. Leader: Robert Halasz[masked], cell[masked], call if weather dubious. Nonmembers: $3.
results.name: SUNSET PARK

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 10AM

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.


Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Brooklyn Soccer Club Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Brooklyn Soccer Club or activities.

results.description:
In today’s demanding, distracting world your mind can be stuck in the past or in the future. But happiness is here in the present moment. It cannot be experienced when you’re regretting yesterday or worried about tomorrow. During The Happiness Workshop will get to know some of the tendencies of our mind that creates so much Stress in our system. Workshop will also include: · Some Yoga postures · Guided meditation and breathing techniques that increase energy and deeply relax the body and mind. So, On this workshop we will learn some breathing techniques, some yoga postures and will experience a guided meditation.

RSVP Here: http://trulyhappy.org/mahwah/happiness-workshop-details?happyId=1358

results.description:
Taiji Basics: Post Training and Qigong

The Post is one of the most useful training methods for Taijiquan. It teaches the body how to use and strengthen the correct muscles (especially the psoas) to move through the form with a vertical spine, while at the same time anchoring to the Earth by use of the breath. Also, it starts to tangibly bring to the body the processes of ‘emptying’ and ‘filling’ the different body parts, which is the basic dynamic of Yin and Yang that we study through this art. 

It is also an unparalleled training drill for self defense; it teaches how to keep your weight always on one leg without thinking about it, which allows to move faster and use the unweighted leg for kicking, for instance. 

The Qigong we’ll be training is the Three Circles Qigong, which is the mother posture of all standing qigong that gives rise to the moving form of qigong that Taijiquan is. Getting used subconsciously to the this structure and opening of the kua in a static manner, will set its application while we go through the moving versions of it, letting us focus instead in others aspects of external and internal structure of the form. 

These are the basic constituents of the Yang form, in terms of physical structure and movement.
results.how_to_find_us: Contact info: 646-820-8653
results.name: FREE LESSONS Taiji Basics: Taiji Post Training and Qigong

results.description:
Stories We Live By 

Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis, Leader, Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture

Details: We as human beings are story-makers and story-tellers and story-believers and story-livers.  From an early age, we’re practically compelled, when we observe how the world works, to make up stories about why things are happening the way they are happening.  What stories we tell ourselves, and how we consciously choose to shape our stories (or not) will make a big difference in the lives we lead.

About the Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis is the new clergy Leader at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. Jone has been an Ethical Culture Leader since 1991, serving Ethical Societies in Chicago, Northern Virginia and Brooklyn. She's currently the President of the National Council of Leaders and a member of the American Ethical Union's Membership Committee.

Sunday programs are held at 11:00 AM at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. For more information, please visit our website: <a>http://www.rysec.org </a>;
results.how_to_find_us: Directions on website or call the office during the week.
results.name: Sunday Program: "Stories We Live By"

results.description:
We are going on another bike ride going North along the Hudson River up to Cliffside Park and back stopping for lunch at the Japanese Market Mitsuwa.


Ride is approximately 18 miles and we will be riding at a casual pace (7-10 MPH). We will be riding on the pathways along the Hudson river on the Jersey side, but there are also some areas where are on the sidewalk along river road and through some parking lots, so you have to watch out for cars in some areas.

Bring your bike and meet Mike outside Trinity where we will start and end the ride.

*Helmets are highly encouraged for safety.

if you are driving into Hoboken allow extra time to find parking. There is also a paid parking lot right next to Trinity (entrance on 3rd street). Note that on Sundays, the metered parking spaces are free.

You can also park at Lincoln Harbor and ride south along the waterfront into Hoboken.

Note that Trinity is actually closed, but we are still meeting across the street from the address (it is at 3rd and Sinatra). Below are pictures of where we will be meeting:

-Mike
results.name: Bike Ride along the Hudson from Hoboken with lunch at Mitsuwa (18 miles)

results.description:
Folks, 
Inviting volunteers to join me at the St Xaviers Church Soup Kitchen on Sunday to serve over 1000 meals to the poor and homeless provided by St Xaviers Pantry.

This is based on the values that we would treat everyone equal,trustworthy, with dignity without any discrimination. We also want to be socially inclusive, including everyone with their preferences, culture and celebrate diversity. We will serve vegetarian dishes. The Soup Kitchen is dependent on volunteers to help work towards sustaining these values our community. If you are interested in being a volunteer, rsvp through this page. You don't have to be particularly skillful, we believe that if you have the passion, that's all that's needed :)


Soup Kitchen provides the aprons, gloves, hairnets. (one can wear their own baseball hat). Long hair need to be tied back unless it all fit in the hair net. We work with you, show you what to do. Please wear something comfortable.

Type of help could vary from coordinating the line, serving meals, Removing empty plates from the table or general helping out. 

Location -

 Church of St. Francis Xavier (Basement Hall)

46 W. 16th Street (Between 6th and 5th Avenue), New York, NY

Time -

11:30 - 3:30 ( You are required to stay till the end)

I will put my number on the meetup wall once we get close to the date. Members might get different responsibilities but will try to work as a group.
results.name: Vounteer At St Xavier's Church Soup Kitchen - Feed the Homeless, Good Karma!

results.description:
Hi all! The news these past few weeks has been dominated by coverage of the upcoming primaries - particularly everyone's favorite real estate magnate, Donald Trump. We'll discuss "The Donald" (seriously, no one could come up with a better nickname?), the meaning of his continued popularity, and the campaigns of the other candidates more generally.

We'll follow this up with a chat about the major stock market decline that has taken every 401k holder in the country for a wild ride. Is it just a correction or a harbinger of a new economic contraction?

And finally, this week marked the 10th anniversary of Hurricane Katrina. How did the storm and destruction of New Orleans impact the way we perceive the federal government and are we better prepared for major disasters than we were 10 years ago?

See you at Grumpy!
results.how_to_find_us: In the back room or garden if the weather permits!
results.name: Trump's Ascent, Primaries, Stock Market Swings, & Katrina Anniversary

results.description:
I am going up to 1000 Island on Sunday August 30 and taking a boat tour of Singer Castle. 3-1/4 Hours – The Singer Castle Tour provides a unique opportunity to visit mysterious Singer Castle on Dark Island.

Singer Castle was built at the turn of the century by Commodore Bourne, president of the Singer Sewing Machine Company, as a hunting lodge. It remained in his family for half a century until it was bought by Reverend Martin in the 60’s who established the castle as a religious retreat.

In 2005 the castle was purchased by a group of German investors and was opened to the public allowing visitors from all over the world to view a castle that had always been shrouded in mystery and as rumor would have it – haunted.

This trip covers an eleven mile section of the St. Lawrence River not offered in any of our other tours. Our experienced tour guides provide a lively narrative during both the down river trip to the castle and return trip back to Alexandria Bay directing your attention to points of interest and sharing historic, environmental and seaway facts. At the castle, trained guides will greet you and provide a one-hour walking tour.

Upon returning upriver to the Alexandria Bay area, your vessel will stop at Heart Island where you have the option to either disembark at Boldt Castle and enjoy a self-guided tour of the castle and its grounds or remain on board and return to Alexandria Bay. Boldt Castle admission is additional.

Highlights of this trip include:
*St. Lawrence Seaway
*Grenadier Island
*Sisters Island Light
*Oak Island
*Singer Castle of course
*Inglenuk, once owned by the famous artist, Frederic Remington
*Various shipwrecks
*Ironsides Island
*Whiskey Island
Tickets are $36 per adult and $16 per children. I really like this tour and it's a lot of fun.
results.name: Singer Castle Tour

results.description:
Join multiple meetup groups as we casually stroll through Prospect Park following random paths at my discretion. Every 6 to 10 minutes (depending on the size of the group) I ask the men to switch with a woman they have not spoken with until everyone has spoken with everyone. It's a great way to meet people and everyone has great things to say about it. 

After the walk, we'll head over to the Food Truck Rally. Trucks in attendance will include Brooklyn Organic Coffee & Tea Truck, Andy's Italian Ices NYC, Carl's Steaks - Philly Cheesesteaks, carpe donut, Coolhaus, DUB Pies, Gorilla Cheese NYC, Kelvin Slush Co., Kimchi Taco, Neapolitan Express, Nuchas, Papaya King, Red Hook Lobster Pound, taim, Toum Food Truck. Please note that trucks vary every weekend.

If this is your first time attending a meetup, try not to worry. Around 90% of attendees are first timers so you won't be alone. Most people come solo and I encourage that. In a matter of minutes you'll be engrossed in a conversation with someone and then another and another. Every 10 minutes I make the guys switch with the girls so everyone gets a chance to talk to everyone. You'll meet like a trillion people! 


How will you find us? We will be meeting right here. The best way to get there is to take the F or G train to the 15 Street Prospect Park subway stop and the meeting spot is right there! Then look for the tallest guy. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. Alternatively, you can CALL (please do not text) the organizer at [masked] and he will wave you over. 


Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.


When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­
results.name: Singles Prospect Park Walk + Food Truck Rally - Age 21 to 49

results.description:
Sign Up Today! https://goo.gl/5oUjoO

Central Park is the most popular of parks for foragers. Because of its varied habitats and the combination of wild and cultivated, native, and exotic plants, Central Park is a great place to forage, even in the winter and early-spring. Here are some of the species we'll be finding:

In the Ramble, we'll be finding large stands of field garlic, with mild-flavored onion-like bulbs, plus the tender young leaves, which you use like chives.

The bland leaves of lesser celandine, magical in the way they remove the bitterness of dandelions (and other bitter greens), also in season, will be at their peak, and the leaves of goutweed, which taste like parsley, only better, will already be growing.

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12pm-3pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is free.  But there is a suggested donation of $15 or whatever you can afford to help cover the room rental and Meetup expenses.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.
results.name: Improv NOW! - Sunday Drop-In Improv Class 12-3pm (FREE)

results.description:
Game 1 of the[masked] season didn't exactly go as anticipated for Juventus, surprisingly falling at home to Udinese.  Nevertheless, the team played well and created several scoring chances giving tifosi much to be excited about for this campaign.  With Sandro and Cuadrado arriving this week, there is even more to look forward to this year.

The second Serie A game will see our beloved bianconeri travel to Roma to take on a team who were clipping at Juve's heels for a while last year until their season began to unravel.  It will be interesting to see if Roma will be serious challengers for the Scudetto in 2015-16.

Always an entertaining match, we hope that you'll come out to The Football Factory at noon EDT on Sunday to watch the game live.

Welcome to all who have joined us over the summer - thank you.

Would anyone like to volunteer to host this meetup as I'm still overseas for an indefinite period?  Please send me a message on here if so.

Long-time JuventiNYC members, please make our new arrivals feel welcome.  If it's your first visit to the Football Factory - it's the downstairs bar (hang an immediate left when you walk in the door) at Legends on W 33rd in Manhattan.  Normally, the Juve matches are shown on the TVs along the right wall after you walk downstairs..wear your black & white jerseys and look for others sporting the same!

Please RSVP if you're planning to attend as it encourages others to do so and helps bar to know how much space to reserve for our group.

Fino alla fine e forza Juventus!
results.how_to_find_us: The Football Factory is the downstairs bar at Legends on W 33rd St (between 5th Avenue & Broadway) in Manhattan

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Our first 1-day Tournament of the season is here!! RSVP while there are spots available!!

Get plenty of touches on the ball and a chance to win 1st. place championship medals!

See details below:

How long will the Tournament last?

Approximately 3.5  hours depending on the amount of teams registered.

What are the rules and level of play?

- 7vs7 (includes the goalkeeper). All teams will have 2 to 3 substitutes.

- CO-ED (no minimum girls required on field)

- 6'x12' size goals.

- Level is intermediate to advance. If you played at a college level or similar, you would be considered Advanced.

- No slide tackles.

-Only turf shoes, indoor shoes or running sneakers.

-3 points for a win, 1 for a tie and 0 for a loss. The teams in the Final Round games are decided by points, goal difference then goals scored.

-We'll keep track of scores. The goals are full size, so if you are a goalkeeper please let us know. Otherwise, teammates will rotate being goalkeeper.

-Everyone will be randomly placed on a team. If you would like to be placed with a particular team, please let us know in the comment section when you rsvp on the top right corner; we will try to accommodate everyone. Also, if you would like to bring your own team, please RSVP for you+9 and pay the total via paypal.

How do I join?
There are 2 ways to join:

1. The first way to join is as a free agent. To join as a free agent please rsvp on this page and we will place you on a team. If you would like to be placed with a friend on the same team, please let us know. We will try to accommodate everyone :)

2. The second way to join is as a team. If you would like to register your team please rsvp on this page for you+ 9 guests and pay the total amount via paypal.

How will the tourney work?

- We are looking to register 3 to 4 teams. The format varies depending on the amount of teams registered. See this link for the format: Tournament Formats

What's included?
- Hired referees
- Permit fees
- Tournament and website administration

- Medals for 1st place winners

What are the prizes?

- Easch player in the winning team receives medals and gains bragging rights :)

Where will we play?

Field Location:The field is located inside Riverside park. The entrance to the park is on west 103rd street and Riverside Drive. For a location map Click here

Directions: By train: 

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

What should you bring?

-Please use cleats or turf shoes and lots of water.

-A white t-shirt, a red t-shirt and a blue t-shirt.

What is the refund policy?

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before the game kickoff in order to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

How do I know if the tourney is canceled due to bad weather?

Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the event is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game and i will post a comment on this page. Please check your e-mail or this page. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul
results.name: 1-DAY TOURNAMENT-Sunday-12pm@Riverside Park on West 103rd St.

results.description:
Photographer & Model Photoshoot Society Presents:

"Bikini and Lingerie Shoot #2 w/Stephanie & Jenny - Aug. 30"

We continue this month with our second summer "Bikini and Lingerie" shoot. We have returning favorite Stephanie Dec and new to the group Jennifer Barr. These two beauties will surely give us their all for some more memorable shots. Definitely not to be missed!

About the shoot:

We'll continue the summer swimwear theme and shoot glamour and pinup style looks. Weather permitting, we'll go outside and shoot some outdoor boudoir. (Disclaimer: The outdoor "woods" area is unkept and although there are many spots to shoot, shooting will be at the discretion of the organizers for safety and overall comfort for the photographers and model) Check out our Photos page for examples of last months outdoor shooting in the "woods".

For new members: Please take the time to read the info below about how the Meetup is organized and how the shooting parameters are setup.

Cost: $80

(Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge)

(Non-Commercial Release provided onsite or PDF version to email registered upon check-in.)

Models:

Stephanie Dec: MM#[masked]

(Photos provided by model for promotional purposes only. All rights their respective owners.)

Jenny Barr: Instagram

(Photo Credits: NandoPro)

(Photos provided by model for promotional purposes only. All rights their respective owners.)

One-on-Ones: The models will be available for half hour one on one shoots after the Meetup. If you want to pre-book time before the shoot, send me a message.

NEW Shared One-on-Ones: We are also implementing a system that has been working for the past few Meetups. It's the sharing of a half hour one on one with a fellow photographer. It can be shared together for the whole half hour or 15 minutes each photographer. 

_______________________________________________________________________

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

About The Meetup Format:

We will keep the group small although we have the space to accommodate a big group. This keeps things from feeling rushed and overwhelming. Each photographer will have a set amount of time per look. This will allow you to  shoot as you would in an actual client shoot and not have to worry about the number of shots you are taking. (This proved to be ideal in our previous shoots as far as being able to get "the shot" and enough time to do so. Think of it as a mini one-on-one time with the model.) During the shoot we may opt to give a theme a direction to shoot for. As it would be for an actual client. (Ex: If the setup calls for a "cover shot" then it will give you a direction to aim for and to consider what equipment to use or what mood to capture.) No worries, bring what lens or lenses you have, you'll learn to use what you have for best results. We strive to bring forth real world conditions and parameters so there is a methodology to a setup or theme.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. So, at the very least give us 3 days notice that you will not be able to attend or in case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up past the 3 days notice, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup.

Waitlist - When you are on a wait list, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels within the 3 days before the shoot, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes". Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please email me at [masked]
results.name: Bikini and Lingerie Shoot #2 w/Stephanie & Jenny - Aug. 30

results.description:
Hey folks, let's hang out in beautiful Greenwood Cemetery and check out all the cool events for the commemoration of the Battle of Long Island, one of the key battles of the Revolutionary War.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Long_Island


There will be reenactments, Colonial foods, a parade, and then we can explore the gorgeous green space designed by Frederick Law Olmsted, who also designed Central Park and Prospect Park.

Afterwards we can go grab a brewsky and food at nearby Greenwood Park, the best outdoor beerhall in Brooklyn!!

Event is free, just dress for the weather and be ready to cheer for the Continental Army against the British!!!!

http://www.green-wood.com/event/commemoration-of-the-battle-of-brooklyn/


see you guys there!!!
results.how_to_find_us: Look for Dan
results.name: Greenwood Cemetery/Battle of Brooklyn Commemoration!!

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
SSRF is now introducing free orientation satsangs for all seekers who want to grow spiritually. These satsangs are conducted via Skype usually over the weekends at convenient timings across different timezones. The aim of these orientation programs is to familiarise new seekers with what SSRF has to offer and how we can best help you in your spiritual journey. 

Once you have attended this orientation satsang, we will be able to put you in touch with our satsang conductors from different regions so that you can then attend our free online spiritual workshops which is most suitable for you. (If you are already attending satsangs with SSRF you do not need to attend an orientation satsang.) 

To attend this satsang, you will need to register at the following link: http://www.spiritualresearchfoundation.org/events/
results.name: SSRF Orientation Satsang

group.name: Spiritual Science Research Foundation - New York, USA

results.description:
It's just about time for our annual trip out to Captain Lawrence Brewery! A staple of Westchester and a recurring target of our Meetup events, Captain Lawrence features a big tasting room and a pleasant outdoor seating area. Let's celebrate the impending end of summer by enjoying the weather and the beer!

Details: there's a little parking on-site, and street parking nearby (around the back). No charge to get in, $2 for a sampler glass (if you've been there before, you can bring your glass from last time), and $5 for 5 sampler chips or $10 for 12. Chips are reusable, so don't be afraid to stock up if you plan on going back.

This year, I planned ahead like a real adult, and scheduled our trip to coincide with a live music event. I don't know if CLBC did this in the past, but it should be a fun change for us this year!

Also, it seems the tours are no longer free and open to the public. You can take the tour by signing up on the website (www.captainlawrencebrewing.com) and paying the $5 fee. I've seen it all already, so I'll save my cash for the alcohol, but it's a nice experience if you haven't done a brewery tour before.

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Captain Lawrence Brewery: Beer and Music!

results.description:
This form is the first self-defense form or training drill that we learn in the Erle Montaigue’s Fajing Chuan system. It is a form that covers every possible defense and counter attack we might find in a real confrontation, and trains our subconscious to react properly in such situations. It also strengthens our muscles, sinews and joints in order to be healthy to defend our life. The series of intricate and specific movements also trains the practitioner in the usage of the correct muscles to strike and to perform fajing (explosive energy). Needless to say, like any other training method in the system, it also improves our self-healing and our ability to heal others, by combining forcefully our mind’s intent with our qi, and teach them how to work together. This is a form that was developed by Yang Shouzhong, Yang Cheng-fu’s eldest son, in order to bring back the Yang energy element stripped in the simplifications made by his father to the original form. 

Note:

These series of free classes are intended to show the both sides of the original Yang style: the ‘softer’ and internal, and the ‘harder/martial’ and external. It will also elucidate the link between the both sides of the same coin - fajing. On one side, we train it slowly, in order to train the subconscious on how to recover that natural expression of energy, and to impart it with some sophistication that makes it more suitable for our higher-goals: self-healing and medical (healing others) work. On the other, we train on how to use it for self-defense purposes, and on how it can help give us the best chance of survival when our life is in true danger.

results.description:
Try out for the New York Badassilisks!

The New York Badassilisks are New York City's oldest Quidditch team. Our core principle is to be competitive while maintaining a fun atmosphere.


As a team, we strive for greatness and help our fellow teammates reach their full potential. The Badassilisks have competed in four World Cups to date and look to increase that number this year. To be a Badassilisk, you must be prepared to work hard and give it your all. Quidditch is a fun sport but it is also a competitive sport so we plan to work hard.

The Badassilisks, however, are more than just a team. We are all friends and family. In addition to our practices and tournaments throughout the year, we hold social events so that teammates can hang out off the pitch as well and get to know each other and have fun.

A Badassilisk is expected to uphold certain principles. On the pitch, a Badassilisk exhibits sportsmanship and never gives up. Off the pitch, a Badassilisk is respectful and helpful to both their teammates and other members of the community.

All experience levels are welcome to come tryout. Whether you are a veteran player or new to the game, we would love to see you come to try-outs. If you are new to the game we will teach you the sport and train you to be a great player.

*Note to current team members: Current team members must attend tryouts for the subsequent season to be considered for a spot on the team.

**If you cannot make this tryout date, please get in touch with us and we can work out a new date that works better for you.

Do you think you have what it takes to be a New York Badassilisk? Come to tryouts!
results.how_to_find_us: When you enter Central Park from 86th St. the team will be in the open clearing on your left.
results.name: New York Badassilisks 2015-2016 Season Tryouts!

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Our first 1-day Tournament of the season is here!! RSVP while there are spots available!!

Get plenty of touches on the ball and a chance to win 1st. place championship medals!

See details below:

How long will the Tournament last?

Approximately 3.5  hours depending on the amount of teams registered.

What are the rules and level of play?

- 7vs7 (includes the goalkeeper). All teams will have 2 to 3 substitutes.

- CO-ED (no minimum girls required on field)

- 6'x12' size goals.

- Level is intermediate to advance. If you played at a college level or similar, you would be considered Advanced.

- No slide tackles.

-Only turf shoes, indoor shoes or running sneakers.

-3 points for a win, 1 for a tie and 0 for a loss. The teams in the Final Round games are decided by points, goal difference then goals scored.

-We'll keep track of scores. The goals are full size, so if you are a goalkeeper please let us know. Otherwise, teammates will rotate being goalkeeper.

-Everyone will be randomly placed on a team. If you would like to be placed with a particular team, please let us know in the comment section when you rsvp on the top right corner; we will try to accommodate everyone. Also, if you would like to bring your own team, please RSVP for you+9 and pay the total via paypal.

How do I join?
 There are 2 ways to join:

1. The first way to join is as a free agent. To join as a free agent please rsvp on this page and we will place you on a team. If you would like to be placed with a friend on the same team, please let us know. We will try to accommodate everyone :)

2. The second way to join is as a team. If you would like to register your team please rsvp on this page for you+ 9 guests and pay the total amount via paypal.

How will the tourney work?

- We are looking to register 3 to 4 teams. The format varies depending on the amount of teams registered. See this link for the format: Tournament Formats

What's included?
 - Hired referees
- Permit fees
- Tournament and website administration

- Medals for 1st place winners

What are the prizes?

- Easch player in the winning team receives medals and gains bragging rights :)

Where will we play?

Field Location:The field is located inside Riverside park. The entrance to the park is on west 103rd street and Riverside Drive. For a location map Click here

Directions: By train: 

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

What should you bring?

-Please use cleats or turf shoes and lots of water.

-A white t-shirt, a red t-shirt and a blue t-shirt.

What is the refund policy?

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before the game kickoff in order to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

How do I know if the tourney is canceled due to bad weather?

Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the event is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game and i will post a comment on this page. Please check your e-mail or this page. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Embodying our soul is the key to authenticity and living a real, grounded, nourishing life.


Today's discussion will tease out the difference between soul (feminine/earth/flesh) and spirit (air/ethereal). It will also clarify why living a life connected to our soul is particularly vital for women.


The effects of disconnection can range from exhaustion, frustration, emptiness, loneliness, depression and more. I am so passionate about women having access to knowledge about the "other half" of spirituality and development.

**I encourage everyone to leave a bit of extra time afterwards to connect with women in the group on a personal level to keep actively building community.

**Additional donations are welcome. These help maintain the high quality facilitation and consistency of programming.  

Location: http://elizabethstreetgarden.org/

results.description:
Updated April 18th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate 
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on Tuesdays/Thursdays and Morningside Park for the weekend games.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien 
[masked]


MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

results.description:
You’ve seen them before, those portraits on the cover of magazines that make you stop and stare, an engaging portrait that is different than the textbook stuff you see everywhere. This is the style of photography Miguel Quiles will be demonstrating for you live in his “Dramatic Portraiture: From Start to Finish” class!Using the latest Sony mirrorless cameras Miguel will cover the basics of creating amazing, dramatic portraits that will make your work stand out from the rest. He’ll also give his best tips for gear, posing, and lighting that will give you the foundation you need to get your work noticed. Then you'll have the opportunity to watch him shoot live and conclude by showing you how he finishes off the image in Photoshop! Quite simply, if you’re interested in photographing people in new and more interesting ways you can’t miss this event! This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes eachAdorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.


Biography:

http://www.adorama.com/alc/sites/default/files/styles/bio_image/public/MiguelQuiles2_HEAD.jpg?itok=wnAdfJZk

 Miguel Quiles is a commercial wedding & portrait photographer based out of New Jersey. He's been involved in the photography industry for over 15 years, starting off first as a salesman at a local camera store. Since that time, Miguel has been refining his skills and pushing the limits of his creative abilities through the medium of photography. As a self-taught photographer, Miguel hopes to share his experience and knowledge with new and upcoming photographers who wish to take their work to the next level.


Follow Miguel Quiles at www.miguelquiles.com, Facebook, and Twitter
results.name: SEMINAR: Dramatic Portraits: From Start to Finish with Miguel Quiles

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play anywhere in NYC, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

results.description:
NOTE: The daily forecast says 89 degrees for Sunday, but the detailed, hourly forecast shows a high of only 87. That's 2 degrees closer to comfort when we're not on the beach!

Let's take a mini-vacation as we ride the A train to the water for a triple: 1) The eerily serene and lovely Jamaica Bay Wildlife Refuge, where some 350 bird and 60 butterfly species have been spotted. 2) A quiet section of Rockaway Beach, where you can swim. We'll travel there by taking a short bus and train ride after lunch 3) Time and energy permitting, we'll walk the boardwalk to one of the great Rockaway restaurants for food and/or drinks. Or, if the majority prefers, we'll walk in the opposite direction through the scenic dune and bird-sanctuary area. (We won't be visiting the Boatel, which was discontinued after last summer.)


SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS: Bring food, water, sunblock (very little shade all day), and Metrocards for one subway and possibly two bus rides during the trip (though we may walk instead of taking the bus). If you're interested in birds, bring binoculars. Boots not necessary.

TICKS: There are some Lyme-disease ticks at Jamaica Bay, though the risk will be very low on our route, according to the ranger I asked. (I've led walks here five times before and never heard of anyone finding a tick.) Ticks lurk on bushes, and we'll be walking almost entirely on wide gravel paths. If you want to be extra-cautious, wear light clothing, tuck your pants into your socks, don't brush against foliage, and consider spraying your clothing with tick repellent containing at least 20% deet. And check your body, especially hairy places, when you get home.  

LUNCH: BRING YOUR OWN. We'll start eating at around 2:30 PM. Add a snack to your pack if you can't hold out till then.

DISTANCE: Roughly 5 miles, give or take a mile. 

ENDING TIME: Approximately 6 PM (later if we go for food/drink), but you can leave earlier of course, starting at lunchtime.


COST: $2, in part to cover Meetup's recently increased organizer fee; if you don't have an unlimited metrocard, $2.75 for one subway ride during the trip and another $5.50 if you'd rather take the bus than walk to and from  the refuge (about 20 minutes each way); and whatever you spend on food and drink if we go to a restaurant/bar.

TRANSPORTATION: A train to Broad Channel (NOT LEFFERTS). From Times Square, the trip should take roughly 1 hour and 5 minutes. For more details, consult hopstop.com, mta.tripplanner.org, or both, since each is occasionally inaccurate. Later in the week, also consult mta.info/weekender.html for weekend service changes

WAITING LIST: Sign up and be patient, no matter how how many are waiting. Long lists  people have totally disappeared because of cancellations, especially at the last minute. And if you're in the top 20 on the list (shown below the main list on the right side of this page on a computer only) at any time before the walk starts you can come.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet us right outside the only exit from the train. I'll be wearing a red cap.
results.name: Jamaica Bay Wildlife & Rockaway beach

results.description:
It is often taken as a given that humankind is divided into nations. The concept of a ‘nation’ provides a base for much of our political worldview, historical understanding and frequently even our own identity. But what exactly do we mean by a ‘nation’ anyway? Are they ancient and primordial, or modern and constructed? If they are created, how are they born and is this process the same the world over? What is nationalism? Are there different types of nationalism? Are nations no longer relevant in our modern ‘globalized’ world or is there plenty of life left in the nation and nationalism?

Come join us to discuss these and other related topics.
results.name: Nations: Past and Present – An Historical Discussion

results.description: When the Whitney Museum of American Art opened its new Renzo Piano-designed home in Manhattan’s Meatpacking District on May 1, 2015, the first exhibition on view was be an unprecedented selection of works from the Museum’s renowned permanent collection. Setting forth a distinctly new narrative, America Is Hard to See presents fresh perspectives on the Whitney’s collection and reflects upon art in the United States with approximately 650 works by some 400 artists, spanning the period from about 1900 to the present. Delving deep into the Whitney’s holdings, America Is Hard to See examines the themes, ideas, beliefs, visions, and passions that have preoccupied and galvanized American artists over the past one hundred and fifteen years. Numerous pieces that have rarely, if ever, been shown before appear alongside familiar icons, in a conscious effort to challenge assumptions about the American art canon.
results.how_to_find_us: Will be waiting at the front of museum beginning at 12:30pm
results.name: "See" America at the Whitney

results.description:
There is always high demand for figure sessions, but I don't have the time to organize more. So my friend (artist extraordinaire) Simon has offered to host some weekly sessions. These events won't impact the regular schedule of the group; they're additional. Hope to see you there! - Jesse

Join us for Saturday figure sketching, at a beautiful space conveniently located in Union Square! We'll be in Suite 505.

Unlike our outdoor Meetups, this one costs money so we can pay for the space and models. It's $15 per person, pay at the door. These sessions tend to be in high demand, so only RSVP if you are pretty sure you will attend! If not, please open the spot for someone else.

Any problems on the day of the event, Simon can be reached at [masked]. 

Looking forward to sketching with you!


What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!


• We sketch for a bit, and then take a break and share our drawings. Then we sketch some more, etc.

• Feel free to bring any media you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos (not of the model) to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• The event will last three hours.

• Everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to the attending list.


Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.
results.name: Weekly Figure Drawing in Union Square

results.description:
Join us for a intellectually and spiritually stimulating afternoon of theory and practice as we celebrate the recent release of Dustin DiPerna's groundbreaking books on Integral Religion and Spirituality, marking the culmination of a seven year journey.

REGISTER HERE: http://diperna-nyc-book-launch.eventbrite.com

These two books, Streams of Wisdom and Evolution's Ally, trace a new path for our world's great wisdom traditions. Using explicit examples and with crystal clear vision, DiPerna shows how each of our world's religions lead to the direct realization of the fundamental Unity of Existence. And how a new developmental understanding of religion provides a pathway beyond more limited, fundamentalist orientation of faith. 

To watch short videos of Dustin introducing these two books, click here and here.

Ultimately, DiPerna provides a pathway for religion and spirituality to have a massively positive impact on consciousness, culture, and society.

American Philosopher Ken Wilber has strongly endorsed both books stating:  "DiPerna's offering provides a series of brilliant first steps toward a vibrant trans-lineage spirituality... DiPerna's work fundamentally changes the way religion and spirituality can (and should) be practiced."

REGISTER HERE: http://diperna-nyc-book-launch.eventbrite.com

Through Dustin's teachings you will:

• Learn how a new developmental approach to religion opens the door for a deeper understanding of the current state of religion in the world

• Discover a clear methodology for working with terrorism and other forms of religious fundamentalism

• Learn how some expressions of religion can stand on equal footing with other rational forms of knowledge acquisition

• Be re-introduced to the sacred, mystical path within each tradition that leads the way Home to Ultimate Reality

REGISTER HERE: http://diperna-nyc-book-launch.eventbrite.com

Please come and support Dustin as he shares his work with the New York community. The afternoon will consist of lecture, group discussion, as well as meditative and inter-subjective practice. If you are interested in learning more about spirituality, integral theory, or how a deeper connection to Ultimate Reality can flourish in your life, this is an event not to be missed!

Dustin DiPerna is founder of Bright Alliance and Co-Founder of Synergy Forum. He is an author, group facilitator, and meditation instructor. Dustin received a Bachelor of Science degree from Cornell University and a Master of Liberal Arts degree in Religion from Harvard University. He is author of three books: The Coming Waves, Streams of Wisdom, Evolution's Ally. Dustin is an internationally recognized expert in the field of Integral Theory, and practices in the spiritual lineages of Mahamudra and Dzogchen. He lives in California with his wife, Amanda, and daughter, Jaya.
results.name: Streams of Wisdom & Evolution's Ally: Book Launch & Practice with Dustin DiPerna

results.description:
Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of Union Square.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  


• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

Join New York Adventure Club on Sunday, August 30th, for a private tour of the historic Temple Emanu-El, the largest house of worship in the world, as well as one of the world's largest synagogues.

Our experience will take us into the incredible main sanctuary, which includes a 175 foot long hand painted & gilded ceiling, more than 60 stained glass windows, and 2,500 hundred seats that have an unobstructed view of the ark. If we're lucky, we'll be able to take a NYAC-only trip to the roof and see the city from one of New York's greatest architectural masterpieces!

Afterwards, we'll grab a bite to eat in the neighborhood!

results.description:
The Dutchess County Fair is a celebration of all things American. It began in 1842, and was attended by nearly 400,000 people just last year.

Some awesome things that you can do on the 144 acres of the fairgrounds:

•  Pet farm animals (goats, cows, sheep)


• Eat food that makes you shout 'Merica! (deep fried oreos, corn dogs, cheese fries)


• Watch horse competitions like carriage driving, weight pulling, cowboy tricks, and jumping


• Hop on a ride that reminds you of childhood and questionable safety standards


• Walk through exhibition halls to see award-winning rabbits, chickens, and other small creatures


• Enjoy the end of summer at an outdoor beer/wine garden


• Spectate a "Dock Diving Dogs" competition


• Watch demonstrations for cooking, quilting, and wood carving


• Try to milk a cow (because you've always wanted to)


• Check out some championship bull riding


• Explore historical replications of a printer's shop, schoolhouse, blacksmith, and sugar house


• Cheer on your favorite pig at the pig races


Tickets:
To buy tickets, visit this link. Prior to Aug. 24, they are $12 per person (with a $1.50 service fee). After Aug. 24, the cost goes up to $15 per person. Parking on the fairgrounds is free.

Getting There:
As a note: the fair is located in Rhinebeck, NY, and is a 1.5-hour ride from White Plains. If you'd like to carpool, please post in the comments below; we may be able to make some connections depending on who can drive and where people live.

You can also take the Hudson Line Metro-North train; just arrive at the Poughkeepsie train station by 10:30am, and you can catch a shuttle to the fair (leaves at 10:55am). However, there is only one return shuttle, which leaves the fair at 4:50pm.
results.name: Let's Pet Farm Animals and Eat Deep Fried Oreos at the Dutchess County Faire!

results.description:
August 30, 2015

Introduction and Practice of Many Divination Tools

Scrying Mirror Water Tarot Tea Leaves Pendulum Divination in Daily Life $25 in person/$27 via paypal - If you paid online PLEASE bring your receipt to class.

WFT Academy of Pagan Studies (WFTAPS) offers the most comprehensive, well-planned and affordable training available anywhere. We have a very interactive community based program. We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Making A BOS, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more.
What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.
Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now NEW! launching in 2013 online classes which will have our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment. Students can join this blog as long as they have registered at WFTAPS for classes
The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!
We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.
We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished thus far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Academy and do hope that after reading this, you will decide to join us as at the Academy as a Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.
We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.

WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.

FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:
www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com
www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com

We provide many sources of learning that go into each and every class, which surpasses others when learning about Wicca / WitchCraft in New York City. We offer First through Third Degree training. Additionally we have many other Witch Crafting Classes & Workshops including: Herbal Intensive Series, Making A BOS, Tarot Classes, Besom Making, Candle SpellCrafting and much more.
What is wonderfully unique about WFT Academy of Pagan Studies is that it allows you to set the pace of your learning experience and provides you with an affordable way to grow within a structured Wiccan learning environment. You will be challenged and we do invite those who welcome this challenge to our Academy. We take your education very seriously, and in turn you should be serious about your education and training in the Path of Wicca / WitchCraft. Before considering enrollment and training at WFT Academy of Pagan Studies keep in mind that it is a life-path commitment.
Within our Academy there is an enormous amount of Community Interaction through the use of meetups, myspace, groups and now NEW! launching in 2013 online classes which will have our newly formed blog and forum etc., further enabling you to increase your knowledge and learning as well as providing you the ability to network with other like-minded individuals in a safe and supportive environment. Students can join this blog as long as they have registered at WFTAPS for classes
The Academy is truly a Spiritual Home and we welcome you to make it your own!
We have Degree-specific Study to discuss challenging lessons, facilitate rituals celebrating the Sabbats and Esbats as well as for healing and self-empowerment, all in a friendly and open atmosphere. We also hold Wiccan Degree dedications marking the stages of your training as you move through the Academy. We have found that many of our Students find it wonderful to be in a group learning environment that they can consider a Community Home.
We are all very proud of our Academy and what we have accomplished thus far. But ever mindful that it is each and every one of the Students that make it what it is. If you are reading this, we are confident that you would make a wonderful addition to our Academy and do hope that after reading this, you will decide to join us as at the Academy as a Student and member of The Wiccan Family Temple.
We welcome you to begin your studies by going to our ADMISSION AND PRICES (where you will find applications) page and submit your enrollment to the Academy today. We look forward to having you join us as a new Student of the WFT Academy of Pagan Studies.
WE ARE ALWAYS IMPROVING UPON WHAT WE OFFER STRIVING AND PROMISING TO ALWAYS KEEP RAISING THE BAR ON WHAT WE OFFER.
WE ARE THE MOST COMPREHENSIVE AND AFFORDABLY TAUGHT WITCHCRAFT ACADEMY WITHIN THE NEW YORK CITY AREA.
IF YOU WOULD LIKE TO FIND OUT FURTHER INFORMATION REGARDING THESE CLASSES, PLEASE GO TO www.ftacademyofpaganstudies.webs.com. YOU WILL FIND REGISTRATION INFORMATION, PRICES AND OUR FULL CURRICULLUM. YOU CAN JOIN IN THESE CLASSES AT ANY TIME, AND CATCH UP WITH THE CLASSES YOU MISSED NEXT TIME IT COMES AROUND.
IF YOU HAVE NOT DONE SO, PLEASE DO BRING YOUR APPLICATION FILLED OUT WITH YOU WHEN YOU COME TO CLASS. ALSO, BRING A NOTE BOOK AND PEN OR PENCIL.
The most comprehensive and affordably taught WitchCraft Classes in NYC
$25.00 per class/$27.00 via paypal, to cover cost of spaces and paper expenses (it is a requirement).
There is a one time fee per year of $25.00 registration fee.
For the first time we are offering pre-registration prices of 24 classes for the year cost is $600.00 with pre-registration it would be $575.00.
What we offer is a year and a day of studies for 1st, 2nd and 3rd Degree. Your 4th year is Apprenticing and at the end of that 4th year your can apply for your State Reverend License through the Wiccan Family Temple.
If you pay online please bring a receipt of payment as we do not always have time to check paypal the day of the class, or we will expect you pay at the class or gathering.
Classes are being held at: 107 Suffolk St., Room: 203 (Between Rivington & Delancey Streets), NY, NY 10002 email us at: [masked] or call us at[masked]-5012.
FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CLASSES, EVENTS ETC. PLEASE VISIT US AT:

www.wiccanfamilytemple.org
www.thenycpagancouncil.webs.com

Hey Guys! So after several weeks of being on sick leave from handball, I am coming back to full health. Briefly to explain, I hurt my back a few weeks ago. Was in serious pain. Finally got cleared by the doc and now I'm seriously in need of handball now! Let's do this! Come on down to Pier 2 where we get the beautiful sun, breeze, and view that we always get there. Hope many of you can make it!

Weekend Transit/Directions: Due to scheduled MTA construction and changes for the weekend, here are the directions that reflect such activities:

Take the A, C or F Train to York St in Brooklyn. Once you are on York St, walk on York toward the Brooklyn Bridge and you will find Old Fulton St. Then walk toward the pier. I would advice if you taking mass transit to check www.mta.info to see what scheduled changes or delays will occur this weekend.  

As always if you get lost or have issues finding the Pier just message myself, Silvia, or Nicholas! 

Weather Notice: Weather Channel predicts a sunny day with highs in the 80s and medium to low humidity. Will send an email update on the weather the morning of.

Cancellation Notice: Meetup cancellations can occur if there is bad weather, low RSVP, or if there is a last minute emergency. If this occurs you will receive an email notice no less than 2 hours before the meetup.

results.description:
Free. Manhattan. Sunday, August 30th @ 1:00PM

Gotham Yacht Club is looking for fun sailors and non-sailors to join us this weekend for one of the last trips of the season!

We take trips around the Manhattan area in a 50-foot Beneteau. We usually sail the Hudson--the Statue of Liberty to the George Washington Bridge--but also go to Martha's Vineyard, the Hamptons and the Jersey Shore.

We like to fill the boat up with about 20-30 people. No sailing experience is required, but preference is given to experienced sailors since the trips can’t happen without them.  As space is limited on the boat, simply RSVP’ing “Yes” to an event does not guarantee a spot on the boat.  If a spot is available, you will be contacted directly with event details.

Sailors can take their first trip to get acquainted and enjoy the party.  From then on, sailors can choose to (1) work the morning shift and help out with the launch or (2) work the evening shift and help out with the return.  Generally, sailors spend less than a third of the trip working and can take the rest of the time to relax and socialize.

The current crew is made up of young, educated Manhattan professionals. We are looking to meet new people who will enjoy the atmosphere and company of everyone on the boat. 

If you and/or your friends are interested, please copy, paste, and fill out the questionnaire below in an email and send to [masked]. Please include your current email address so that we can contact you directly.  Since boat trips fill up in advance and we receive many applicants, we may not get back to you immediately.  

We look forward to seeing you on the water!

EVERY APPLICANT (REVELERS, SUNBATHERS, ETC.)

Q) Please provide a link to your page on Facebook or other social networking site. Please attach a picture if you don’t have a page on a social networking site.

Q) How old are you?

Q) Where did you attend school?

Q) Will you please tell us a little bit about yourself?

FOR SAILOR APPLICANTS

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on, but not captained, a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on but not captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) Will you tell us a little bit about your sailing experience?


Please copy and paste all questions and answers and send in an email to [masked].

Thank you!


FAQ


Q: Do you have to pay to attend a boat party?


A: No, all boat parties are absolutely free.  You may want to bring food and drinks, which are on a potluck basis.


Q: The specific location is not listed.  Where do we meet for the boat party?


A: Unfortunately, we cannot fit everyone who RSVPs to a MeetUp event onto the boat.  There are some crew members and attendees who are not part of the MeetUp group, so there may be less space than it appears.  In order to avoid miscommunication and needing to leave people on the dock, specific details (including meeting location) are sent to members individually.  If you do not receive an invitation via email, you will not be able to attend that week’s boat party.


Q: How often are the boat parties?


A: Boat parties are generally every weekend, either on a Saturday or Sunday. They generally last all afternoon into the early evening. 


Q: Do I have to fill out the questionnaire?


A: Yes! Please fill out the questionnaire as thoroughly as possible.  If you are uncomfortable posting any of the information on your profile, please email your responses to [masked].  Without a complete application, you will not be considered to receive an invitation.  The trips last several hours, so we will have 20-30 people in a confined space for an extended period of time. Therefore, we need to have an idea of who we are inviting on the boat and ensure that we have a proper crew.  Please fill out the questionnaire if you are interested in sailing with Gotham Yacht Club.
results.name: Sunday Sail-One of the Season's Last Trips!

results.description:
Integral NY has teamed with Integral Alignment for our August meetup.

Join us for a intellectually and spiritually stimulating afternoon of theory and practice as we celebrate the recent release of Dustin DiPerna's groundbreaking books on Integral Religion and Spirituality, marking the culmination of a seven year journey.

Sunday 8/30 1-4 PM

TICKETS AVAILABLE HERE: 

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/streams-of-wisdom-evolutions-ally-book-launch-and-practice-session-with-dustin-diperna-tickets-17798932085

These two books, Streams of Wisdom and Evolution's Ally, trace a new path for our world's great wisdom traditions. Using explicit examples and with crystal clear vision, DiPerna shows how each of our world's religions lead to the direct realization of the fundamental Unity of Existence. And how a new developmental understanding of religion provides a pathway beyond more limited, fundamentalist orientation of faith.

Ultimately, DiPerna provides a pathway for religion and spirituality to have a massively positive impact on consciousness, culture, and society.

American Philosopher Ken Wilber has strongly endorsed both books stating: "DiPerna's offering provides a series of brilliant first steps toward a vibrant trans-lineage spirituality... DiPerna's work fundamentally changes the way religion and spirituality can (and should) be practiced."


Through Dustin's teachings we will:

- Learn how a new developmental approach to religion opens the door for a deeper understanding of the current state of religion in the world

- Discover a clear methodology for working with terrorism and other forms of religious fundamentalism

- Learn how some expressions of religion can stand on equal footing with other rational forms of knowledge acquisition

- Be re-introduced to the sacred, mystical path within each tradition that leads the way Home to Ultimate Reality


The afternoon will consist of lecture, group discussion, as well as meditative and inter-subjective practice. If you are interested in learning more about spirituality, integral theory, or how to foster a deeper connection to Ultimate Reality in your life, this is an event not to be missed!

-----

Dustin DiPerna is founder of Bright Alliance and Co-Founder of Synergy Forum. He is an author, group facilitator, and meditation instructor. Dustin received a Bachelor of Science degree from Cornell University and a Master of Liberal Arts degree in Religion from Harvard University. He is author of three books: The Coming Waves, Streams of Wisdom, and Evolution's Ally. Dustin is an internationally recognized expert in the field of Integral Theory, and practices in the spiritual lineages of Mahamudra and Dzogchen. He lives in California with his wife, Amanda, and daughter, Jaya.

results.description:
Transmission Meditation with Meryl Tihanyi Alternate Sundays Beginning March 1st
1:00-3:00pm
Free Do you want to help the world and also build a stronger connection with your own spiritual nature? Transmission Meditation is a simple group meditation that provides both a dynamic service to the world and the opportunity for powerful personal spiritual development. *It is a group meditation based on the Science of Triangles, that makes possible the scientific distribution or transmission of highly potent spiritual energies into the world.
*It is the creation, in conscious co-operation with the Masters of Wisdom, of a vortex or pool of higher energy for the benefit of humanity.
*It is a combination of two yogas: Karma yoga (the yoga of service) and Laya yoga (the yoga of energy or chakras).
*Introduced to the world in 1974 by artist and author Benjamin Creme, there are now hundreds of Transmission Meditation groups active in many countries around the world.
*It is safe, and will enhance and complement any other spiritual practice or service activity in which you may already be engaged. Come to a FREE introduction to Transmission Meditation, followed by a group meditation.
results.name: Transmission Meditation with Meryl Tihanyi
