results.description:
Where: Fort Washington Park - Tennis Court #9
 When: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm (1st Hour is Lesson, 2nd Hour is Practice and Play with other students)
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners are All Welcome
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the theMindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on yourMindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Fort Washington Park Tennis Courts

Via 181 Street Subway Stop

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station. Sit in the back of the train.

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, Walk 1 minute on Riverside Drive to the Light Green Pedestrian Bridge

4. Make a Left to walk across the bridge.

5. Take the Ramp down from the bridge, Follow the path which will zigzag slightly.

6. Follow the path under the GW Bridge.

7. Just South of the GW Bridge, arrive at Court #9 for your lesson with Tennis World.

Plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule times

It will take about 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to Court #9. Plan to arrive about 15 minutes before scheduled class to start on time.

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

results.description:
Angelika Film Center

18 W. Houston St., New York, NY 10012 

SHOWTIME: 4:00 PM

Grandma

R| 1 hr. 18 min

Plot Summary 

Lily Tomlin is Elle Reid. Elle has just gotten through breaking up with her girlfriend when Elle's granddaughter Sage unexpectedly shows up needing $600 bucks before sundown. Temporarily broke, Grandma Elle and Sage spend the day trying to get their hands on the cash as their unannounced visits to old friends and flames end up rattling skeletons and digging up secrets.

Cast: Lily Tomlin , Julia Garner , Marcia Gay Harden ,Judy Greer , Sam Elliott , Laverne Cox , Nat Wolff , John Cho

Director: Paul Weitz

Genres: Comedy drama

Distributor: Sony Pictures Classics

REVIEWS:

New York PostLou LumenickAug 20,[masked]Tomlin and Elliot relive their characters’ pain and anger so deeply that they could very well both end up with Oscar nominations.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe New York TimesA.O. ScottAug 20,[masked]There is much to praise about this sweet, smart comedy of intergenerational conflict and solidarity.... But honestly, the wonder that is Grandma can be summed up in two words: Lily Tomlin.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe PlaylistKatie WalshJun 11,[masked]On the surface, Grandma is a simple story, but the script imbues it with deep reserves of emotional depth and meaning that are slowly, organically revealed over the course of the plot.All this critic's reviewsRead full review

results.description:
Here's the August book, picked by your friendly neighborhood organizer:


"In the far future, humans have colonized a distant planet, home to the enigmatic Ariekei, sentient beings famed for a language unique in the universe, one that only a few altered human ambassadors can speak. Avice Benner Cho, a human colonist, has returned to Embassytown after years of deep-space adventure. She cannot speak the Ariekei tongue, but she is an indelible part of it, having long ago been made a figure of speech, a living simile in their language. When distant political machinations deliver a new ambassador to Arieka, the fragile equilibrium between humans and aliens is violently upset. Catastrophe looms, and Avice is torn between competing loyalties: to a husband she no longer loves, to a system she no longer trusts, and to her place in a language she cannot speak—but which speaks through her, whether she likes it or not."

We'll be doing a new book poll soon for the book to read after this one. 

If you need to reach me with a book suggestion or anything at all, feel free to email me:

[masked]


LOCATION
We will be meeting at the Citigroup Atrium.

There is an entrance at 53rd and Lexington Avenue off of the 53rd and Lex subway stop. You have to go down the steps; the subway station will be on your right and the Atrium will be straight in front of you. The doors are labelled.   

There is a Barnes and Noble (with a Starbucks inside) located on the next level up at 54th and 3rd. If you enter through the B&N, you will need to go through B&N (up a few steps from the entrance), past the NOOK display to the glass doors and down the escalator to the Atrium.

There is free wi-fi in the Citigroup Atrium. There are also free public restrooms. Please let me know if you have any questions about the location.

It's probably more fun if you read/finish the book.  But if you don’t, you are still welcome to come. But there will be spoilers!

WHERE TO BUY
The book is available in many formats, including Kindle and paperback at Amazon and a Nook and paperback at Barnes & Noble</a>. 


IMPORTANT RSVP POLICY
If you RSVP and find you cannot make it, please change your RSVP so that we are not waiting for you. Please change it no less than two hours before the scheduled meeting time. If you RSVP and do not show, you will have to pay $10 when you attend your next event. This is to prevent those on the waiting list from missing out on an event.   

The RSVP policy is the same as for the general meetup. Please see the entire policy here:  <a href="http://www.meetup.com/NYSciFi-Fantasy/pages/Membership_Policy/">http://www.meetup.com/NYSciFi-Fantasy/pages/Membership_Policy/
results.name: Sci Fi Book Club: Embassytown by China Mieville

results.description:
Welcome back everyone! Come <a>play</a> some <a>beach volleyball</a> :) <a>Games</a> will be 4x4, rotating 3 teams, rally scoring to 15. 

Things to Know: Wondering what intermediate means? <a>Simply</a> put, you know what second ball means, and you can bump, set and spike.

Over all you can receive a <a>serve</a> and get it to the setter, reliably serve  and hot the ball over the net.  

Here is a <a>video</a> of the level of <a>play</a> we <a>expect</a> at the bare minimum . 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1Nf4aM-hEzE

But this is how we think we play...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Zmfd9etbXGE

We are a fun and friendly group. Any arguments over calls will be a redo.

• "Daria plays" are discouraged, but you get one freebie.

• Dancing between plays is allowed! 

• <a>Open</a> invites to drinks/ <a>lemonade</a> after the game :) Losers can drown their sorrows. 

• Sorry guys no refunds on day of cancellations!

• PLEASE LET US KNOW IF YOU ARE NOT GOING TO MAKE IT.  Two no shows = ban for a month. 

Where is it?

Pier 25 is located by the <a>West Side Highway</a> between North Moore St. and Harrision St. It's the first Pier north of <a>Battery</a> Park City.

http://pier25.com/location/

Closest <a>subways</a> are: Canal (A, C, E), Franklin St. (1), <a>Chambers</a> on the (A,C, 2,or 3)

This week we will be <a>playing</a> at an Intermediate <a>level</a>. Bumping and setting consistently, and no carrying allowed. If you are unsure if you are at the <a>required level</a>, please <a>message</a> Joe and he will inform you if you can <a>sign up</a>. If you do sign up and are not at that level, you will be asked to sit this one out and refunded your payment. We will have an <a>open play</a> <a>meet up</a> again next week. Thanks!
results.name: 4x4 Intermediate

2015 Wimbledon ends with Djokavic defeating Federer in the finals. At the same time, the seats of Arthur Ashe Stadium are being washed and polished for the next tennis tournament : The 2015 U.S. Open. Tickets to the game can get quite pricey, but luckily during the trials, we get to walk around for free!

it's ok Federer, you'll get him next time!

Djokavic, the indestructible machine.

Join us in the arvo (afternoon) at the stadium on Saturday (08/29) to walk around during tennis trials and to watch a few games. Have your eyes wide open, your cameras ready and cross your fingers to meet your favourite tennis player. Or even more, bring your blackest marker and wear your whitest t-shirt, you'll never know who you'll see!

[Queens International Night Market has been moved forward to a separate event, as this event now lands on a Sunday. Night Market is only on Saturdays]

Want to know what's it like to face a 150MPH ball?

http://nyti.ms/1KW77mt

[EDIT] For Those keen for dinner afterwards, we shall go to Flushing's Nan Xiang Dumpling House (Cheap michelin recommended dumplings). Join us if you're keen!

results.description:
Women Artist-Magicians in Mexico

Surrealism and magick draw upon the language of the unconscious. The surrealists’ interests in magic, the supernatural, and indigenous spirituality are expressed in their art and writings.

Leonora Carrington and Remedios Varo fled from Europe to Mexico in World War II. They lived in a community of expatriates in Mexico City. They became close friends, studying magick and alchemy together and painting in a similar surrealist style.

Frida Kahlo was born in Mexico. She did not formally practice magick or a pagan religion (that I know of) but her work has many magical elements and goddess imagery.

We will also look at the work of Mexican artists Maria Izquierdo, Lola Cueto, Olga Costa, and Helen Escobedo.

“Anyway, Art [making] is a magic which makes the hours melt away and even days dissolve into seconds, isn't that so, dear lady?” ― Leonora Carrington, ‘The Seventh Horse And Other Tales’

Feel free to bring snacks to share.

We ask a $2.00 donation to pay the meetup fee.
results.name: Women Artist-Magicians in Mexico

results.description:
In this powerful session we will come together in a circle and perform a special meditation that envisions supreme success for everyone present.  Each individual will write down his or her goal and the entire group will meditate on seeing those goals come to fruition.  As participants, everyone’s energy will be applied to helping you reach your yearned-for target.  

In our Winner’s Circle your success is guaranteed because the whole group will focus on seeing you achieve your goal! 

We all want success.  However, everyone’s definition of success is different.  But for most of us it can be defined by the three key areas of life; health, wealth, and love.  In today’s society we are told there are countless different ways to achieve our dreams yet many techniques fall flat on their face.

Many self-help gurus provide great motivational speeches on how to reach the heights of success, pumping our emotions up only to have reality come crashing down after the seminar is over.  The truth is that the path to success is unique to each and every individual.  It can happen overnight or through a period of hard work over the course of many years.

Although there is no ‘one size fits all’ secret formula to success, there are some quantifiable principles that when applied properly can change your life.  Master Qesankh Maa Kheperu has a proven formula that works with you especially for you. And it does not involve a lot of hard work!  First and foremost, you must realize that your success is intrinsically tied to your destiny.  In other words, you made an agreement before you were born to have certain experiences in life.  Understanding this will help you to determine any unforeseeable roadblocks in your climb to the top.

Next and most importantly, you must understand that striving for success by following a blueprint, attending a seminar, or listening to audio programs are great stepping stones but are not the key.  The real secret to success is in tapping into the most powerful force there is.  What is that force?  It is what we call the indwelling intelligence that resides within you.  It is your spirit.  If commanded or programmed correctly your spirit will work on autopilot to push you towards supreme success.

Once the spirit has been given a directive it will guide you to the right people, places, and resources at the right time.  Some call this synchronicity.  But since the spirit is all-knowing it can even give you information on the right sources to go to so that you can gain special favors, loans, or even fame.

Unfortunately, our society is hell-bent on promoting the idea that the attainment of success can only be achieved through hard work and/or networking with the right people.  However, the real truth is that your spirit, when programmed correctly, will manifest all that you need.  But there is something that is even better.

When groups of people come together for a single objective then they become truly unstoppable!  The more energy, the more power.  Each person will be given a special mantra to summon the chi or Ra force energy.  So please bring your goal written down so that the energy we’ll be providing can be focused immediately.  The group will take turns meditating on each other’s objectives.  Your goal will be super-charged with the powerful energy of the entire group, ensuring your unlimited success.

This will also be an opportunity to gather with like-minded individuals and form lifelong connections.  Join us for this wonderful, inspiring event!

This session will be dedicated to the Goddess Auset/Isis.  Donations to our cause are always welcomed but never obligatory.
results.name: Join The Winner's Circle with Qesankh Maa Kheperu

results.description:
All righty. A Sunday afternoon of trivia at Cosi on 8th Street in lower Manhattan. Free refills on coffee and sodas. So sign up and join us.  Note that this Cosi closes at 6 pm on Sundays. At least we know this ahead of time.  Here are the games we'll be playing

TIMES TO REMEMBER - guess what year an event happened Range is 1950 to 1992.

BEAT THE EXPERTS - team game where you try to answer more questions than a given expert did. Experts include scientists, authors and show biz folks.

SORT IT OUT - put things in order, like shortest to tallest

BELIEVE IT OR NOT - about the odd and bizarre

So there you go.

results.description:
ONLY ONE MORE WEEK TO ENJOY THIS EXCLUSIVE TOWN POOL! SUNDAYS FORECAST IS HOT AND HUMID SO COME ENJOY ONE MORE DIP and lets' celebrate the end of summer together! Theres' always  room to swim! (adult swims called if needed)

MEET JAY GLASER  BY THE ENTRANCE AS WE ARE HIS GUESTS OR GIVE HIS NAME WHEN YOU COME IN .   (MEET to the RIGHT OF THE  DIVING BOARDS if possible) Look for Meetup sign. 

There are grassy areas and many, many free chairs available (first come basis) so you may want to bring your own lounge chairs, umbrellas and blankets. Food & Refreshments with healthy choices are also available to purchase. Option to eat at Peppercorns just up the road from the pool. (turn left upon leaving parking lot on Colony and Peppercorns will be on  your right at the corner) SCROLL DOWN FOR MORE INFO:

Bring  snacks to share,  cards, etc and don't forget the sun protection and bugspray!

Stay for an hour or two or  stay til closing at 8 if you choose!  Admission is only $5.50 weekdays and $7.00 weekends for seniors, $10 for adults weekdays and $14 weekends the whole day and you do not have to be a resident!  Senior Residents are FREE.

We only have til Labor Day, to enjoy these pools, so let's take advantage while the sun is shining!! Hope to see yah there. Let's "air out" those " tired dogs”!

Directions From Rockland County: Take Rt 45(Chestnut Ridge Rd) toward Jersey to  Grand Ave..

Turn left onto Grand Ave..

Turn right on Spring Valley Rd. at light.

In a short distance turn left on Colony Ave. at Peppercorn Restaurant sign.

Pass Peppercorns restaurant immediately on your left and pool parking lot will come up shortly on your right.  LOOK FOR THE PARK RIDGE POOL SIGN ON THE ROCK.   Park and walk across the blue bridge to the entrance.

FOR additional DIRECTIONS GO TO: http://swim.isport.com/swimming-pools/us/new-jersey/park-ridge/park-ridge-municipal-pool-1018734 Enter your address and click on directions box.

Inclement weather cancels.  Always check the day of an event for any changes.  See photos below for landmarks.

Note diving boards and area to the right above (if not available look for meetup sign)
results.how_to_find_us: MEET JAY GLASER AT ENTRANCE / OR give his name when you come (MEET IN the area to the right of the diving boards)look for those who signed up & the Meetup sign
results.name: Stay Cool at the Park Ridge Pool One More time!

results.description:
Join us for an afternoon of Japanese & English language exchange! We will be meeting this Sunday, February 1, from 3-5PM--45 minutes of each language, and then free exchange during the last half hour.

This week's discussion will be about Osaka's proposal to ban hate speech.


If you're learning Japanese, please read this article before coming on Sunday:
ヘイトスピーチ　「基本法」審議に本腰を


And if you're learning English, please read this article before Sunday:
Hate speech in Japan: To ban or not to ban?

We would like to have 10 Japanese learners and 10 English learners attend this event, so please check the RSVP list before signing up. If you see that your section is already full, please send me an e-mail at [masked] and I will put you on waitlist in the event that a spot becomes free.

And please take our survey if you haven't already. We want to know what interests you and what Ameripon can do to better your English/Japanese learning experience.

Looking forward to chatting/しゃべる'ing with all of you this Sunday. お楽しみ！

-Kevin（ケビン）
Organizer, Ameripon
results.name: Ameripon Japanese & English Conversation Exchange

Join the group as we host a live fantasy football draft at Break Billiards. Each round you select players at different offensive positions that you would like on your roster. results.description:
Central Park is a three dimensional work of art with the intended effect of “refining and elevating people’s spirits.” Come explore the souther section of the most visited public space in all of the United States and connect your understanding of it with the monuments that define the spaces we cover on this tour.

Itinerary:
• Grand Army Plaza
• Doris Friedman Plaza
• Central Park Zoo
• The Mall
• Bethesda Terrace and Fountain
• Strawberry Fields
• And Much More

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins by the Pulitzer Fountain in front of the Plaza Hotel (between 58th & 59th Sts. and 5th Av.) map here. Tour concludes on Central Park West and 72nd St). map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You are not charged. At the end of the tour you can put a value to the information presented in the form of a gratuity. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

Central Park is a landmark to remember. Connect your memory of it to works of art that will be there for time immemorial.
results.how_to_find_us: I will be in front of the Pulitzer Fountain on 5th Av. between 58th and 59th streets.
results.name: The Art and Culture of Central Park

group.name: Art, Culture & Museum Tours in NYC by 5D Guide

results.description:
We will have a bit of a hiatus this summer return together at the end of August. Our next Common Ground meetup will be Sunday, May 30, at 3:00 pm. We already began using a new book to help us focus our discussions: Einstein's God: Conversations about Science and the Human Spirit.  It has already engendered some interesting and spirited conversation. As promised, we will provide a chapter by chapter synopsis for each of our meetings.

For those who like Twitter, we also have a Common Ground twitter feed we began with our humanist and religious friends in the United Kingdom in 2013. You are welcome to join the conversation, share and discover how others see this dialogue.

We will share more specifics too of our dialogue conference at Rutgers University this fall with the American Humanist Association, and the convening of the World Parliament of Religions in Salt Lake City afterward.

Happy Summer, Carl
results.name: Conversations Among Humanists, Atheists and Religious Believers

results.description:
Hello Everyone!

ALL LEVELS WELCOME


Also check out my website www.tennis-buffs.com



Packanack Lake Tennis Club (only 20-30 min from the GWB)

9 Osborne Terrace, Wayne 07470

10 outdoor red clay and hard courts

$40 includes tennis, balls and BBQ

 

All levels welcome


IF YOU'RE SIGNING UP THROUGH MEETUP AND IT'S YOUR FIRST TIME -- YOU MUST CALL OR EMAIL ME.  I would like to stagger players to come different hours.

Spend Sunday afternoon with old and new friends playing tennis and having BBQ at Packanack Lake!  For those who haven't been to the Lake, it's like being at a resort or in your own backyard with a nice deck, overlooking clay courts.  When you are there, you will not think about anything else except fun and relaxation.  All levels are welcome.  You will play 3 hours of tennis depending on how many people sign up.  Bring your friends and families.  The More the Merrier!


 

GENERAL ANNOUNCEMENTS
RESPECT FOR SPACE WE SHARE
Please pick up after yourself when you finish eating.  It spoils the environment for everybody else while they're sitting out and socializing during their off hour, sharing the same area.  It's nice to have respect for the space we all share.  Please help me, as I'm juggling many things to create a fun evening for everyone.

BALLS ON COURT
A friendly reminder, please find the 3 balls that you played with and place them by the net for the next group of players.  Often people cannot find the balls or they are mixed in with old balls, not ones from the night's party.

HAND BALLS TO SERVER
Be considerate and wait for the server or the partner to turn around before sending balls over the net.  It's safer, saves time and just good court etiquette.

BE SUPPORTIVE OF YOUR PARTNER
Every once in a while we need to be reminded that we keep a positive attitude on the court.  People come for the enjoyment of the game and to meet other people in a social setting.  Please be a sportsman and be supportive of your partner.  It isn't fun for anyone on the court to see discontent being shown through facial expressions, body language or even scolding.  Let's keep the parties fun and enjoy the evening.

 


Look forward to meeting old and new friends at the next parties!

Thanks,
Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com - website

results.description:
Introducing our new Meetup! No need to prep for this one. Just bring up to 1,500 words of writing—a flash piece or an excerpt from a longer piece you are working on or the outline of an idea that you need help with. People are encouraged to bring work generated through Writing Room exercises.

The format works like this:

Each writer gets a total of up to 30 minutes, which begins when they read their piece aloud or give a pitch of their idea in five minutes or less. We will be able to do 4 or 5 pieces/ideas per meeting. Names will be drawn at random. (Anyone whose work is not chosen will get priority at the next meeting.) You don’t need to bring work to attend and no advance preparation is required.

Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!

results.description:
Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Multi-language picnic! PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY, READ all of description below so you're informed!  :)

We will meet BY THE BENCH at park entrance with FLAGS or a MEETUP SIGN from 3:50-4:10 PM. Please come early

We split into small groups by language. 10+ languages! beginners and native speakers welcome! Look for the sign of your language and join the group!

Language sections we have:
English - Spanish - French -Italian - Portuguese - Chinese - Japanese - Korean - Russian - German - Arabic - Hebrew 

If you would like to attend, you must bring either:

a) FOOD (would be great if relevant to your language but not necessary)!
b) DRINKS with plenty of disposable cups (2 large bottles at least)!
c) SUPPLIES, paper plates, napkins, forks (& knives, spoons) trash bags!

If you do not bring food you must contribute $5. It is $1 to attend. This is a picnic! the idea is to share! Bring food, so you don't have to pay the $5!

You can either make or buy something but whatever you bring should be able to be shared with your language group. GUYS especially, you should spend at least $5 on something, it's totally not enough to just bring a bottle of water or a roll of napkins, (or 3 old bananas!), if you don't know what to bring follow the "abc" choice list above! Please be considerate to other members.

We will be mostly sitting on the grass. Bring a sheet to sit on & proper attire, forecast says 75! We will split off into small groups by language and spread out into conversational language practice groups of Spanish, English, French, Portuguese, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Hebrew, German, Arabic & Russian.

You will have option to meet us at a specific corner between 3:50 and 4:10 (20 minutes). If you're not familiar with Central Park, please be on time, and meet us at corner, otherwise it will be difficult to find us! 

IMPORTANT RULES
1. Please CHECK-IN with us as soon as you get in for a name tag. 

2. We are asking all members to spend at least 1/4 of their time HELPING out in their native language! That way we all help each other, you meet people interested in your culture and you make more friends!

3. Please CLEAN UP after yourselves! (coffee cups, papers, etc) Members who don't will be removed from our group!

4. Fee will be charged $1 for the event

5. If you bring nothing you must pay $5 to attend.

6. If you can't come to the event please update your RSVP status before it closes, so other members have the opportunity to come. (members that RSVP yes and don't show 3 times will be removed from the group)

7. If you come to this event is because you agree to our rules above. We REMOVE members that break our rules, are rude, aggressive or socially inappropriate towards our members. 

*BRINGING KIDS: Due to some experiences and comments we had in previous events. We don't encourage anyone to bring kids to the picnic. You can bring them only if:

1. They are also learning a language.

2. You will have your attention on them 100% of the time. If you just sit in your language group and let them unattended you will be removed from the group.
results.name: Language Exchange Picnic! New location!

results.description:
Picnic number 3 will be held at the lovely Carl Schultz Park. This is always a great breezy picnic spot. 

We will be sitting on the ground for this one so please make sure to bring beach towels, blankets, or whatever you desire to sit on. You may also want to bring  a non-alcohol beverage as you will probably get thirsty. 

For this event any type of food goes, but it must be on a stick. That includes desserts. Feel free to get creative with it, and yes toothpicks are tiny sticks so that counts.

To participate you must bring at least one food on a stick. If you would like to drink with us please contribute a bottle of wine or cocktail. Remember open alcoholic beverages are not allowed in public places in New York City so please be discreet about it. 

If you need some inspiration or recipe ideas I have included a few links below. Feel free to use any .

http://www.cookinglight.com/food/recipe-finder/food-on-stick-recipes


http://www.buzzfeed.com/christinebyrne/kebabs-all-day-every-day#.lgqYdvgKO


http://www.brit.co/100-on-a-stick/

This event is dog friendly, Pepper my yorki poo will be joining us. Feel free to bring your dogs as well. 

Please pick out what you would like to cook and confirm that you can make this event on August 30th. Let us know which dish you want to cook in your RSVP so we can avoid any repeats. Each cook may bring one non-cook to enjoy the meal!

Cancellations: Please be 100% committed to attending this event, and cancel 48 hours in advance. There is limited space and each member puts in a lot of time, effort, and planning into each of these events. Late cancellations affect the group as a whole. If you cancel with less than 48 hours notice, or are a no show you could be removed from the group.

results.description:
Come find Happiness and Peace in this 60 minute workshop and learn tools to be happy and stress free.


In the workshop you will get a taste of the peace and clarity one can achieve through guided meditation & breathing techniques. The workshop also offers a preview of a longer workshop called The Happiness program.

The Happiness Program teaches several practical and powerful tools to help you discover your unlimited power and freedom - not as a concept, but as a direct experience. 

You will discover that you can be happy, whatever the situation, and live a deeply fulfilling life. You will be able to discover and live your highest potential and gain a clear vision of who you really are.

More @ Behappymc.org

How to carve, dress and glitter your candle for a particular spell outcome.  The many types of candles and their purposes. How can we apply this knowledge in on our personal lives to make it better.

$30.00 per class, plus $10.00 material fee for the items needed to carve your own candle. Booklet included.

Always check for further updates to any events, classes, or celebrations on meetup.com at link:

$30.00 per class, plus $10.00 material fee for the items needed to carve your own candle. Booklet included.

Always check for further updates to any events, classes, or celebrations on meetup.com at link:

- See more at: http://www.wftacademyofpaganstudies.org/crafting-of-the-witch-classes/#sthash.JMuy3Fy7.dpuf

ATTN. LINDY HOPPERS AND ALL YOU OTHER DANCERS OUT THERE:

Please come join our own John Festa at the Lincoln Center Local: Silent Disco in the Bronx. John will be spinning the swing portion of the silent dance party at Woodlawn Cemetery. It is the resting place of Duke Ellington, Frankie Manning and many other great jazz artists. The dancing will be in a park-like area of the cemetery called Fairview Lawn.

Last year, thousands of people gathered for the first outdoor silent disco party in Long Island City. This year, the party involves all five boroughs and it’s all free. Join us in the Bronx for a rare chance to dance at the historic Woodlawn Cemetery. Practice your moves at a salsa lesson and then dance the evening away as our DJs deliver great dance tracks, including disco, salsa, blues, and swing, straight to your headphones.

Headphones are free, but you’ll need a credit card or ID to borrow them. Bags are not allowed on the dance floor, so leave them at home.

results.description:
Where:

Beautiful Bryant Park

We'll be on the upper terrace in front of the William Cullen Bryant statue in between the restaurants.

What:

Write a note to someone important to you. Or write a note to a stranger or quasi-stranger in your daily life to make them smile.

We are writing love letters, notes of thanks, encouragement, and inspiration. To your dad, your niece, the mailperson, the barista who remembers your order every time, the MTA conductor. Anyone you want to thank or celebrate. Strangers, the military, the middle school teacher, prisoners, nursing homes, your super, someone looking sad + lonely.


What's a job you'd HATE to do? Let's thank that person!

Or was there something you always wanted someone in your life to know but never had the guts or the timing was never right? Whatcha waiting for?


Let's hide love notes around the city for anyone to find.

Bring:

Yourself

Your friends

Note cards, stationary, markers, stickers...whatever might tickle your creative fancy. Address book, stamps, poetry, favored bits of inspiration.

I will have some supplies but how far it will stretch depends on turn out.


WATER because summer. Snacks if you're inclined. There's a Pain Quotidien, Organic Avenue, Zeytinz + a Pax less than a block from the park.

Why:

Because love. Because you have something to tell someone. Because getting it off your chest feels awesome. Because you're powerful + your words, your goodwill, your energy have a huge effect in this world. Because it's so flipping easy to make someone's day. Because good vibes are contagious.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drinks

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 39-49- 1F/3M spot sleft

5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.

results.description:
TOEFL/TOEIC Workshop・TOEFL/TOEIC対策の講座


What's going on?

JCAG offers TOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language) and TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) workshops for all of you interested in preparing for the tests. The TOEFL tests and measures the ability to use English at the university level, and the TOEIC tests and measures the ability to use English in an international business environment.


(Details)


- TOEIC sessions are held once a month on the first Sunday, and the remaining Sundays are devoted to the TOEFL. This week, we are focusing on the reading portion of the TOEFL test.


- The lessons focus on all the aspects of the tests (reading, writing, listening, and speaking) as well as other aspects such as pronunciation and composition ability in a focused yet fun and productive environment.

When & Where:

Date: Sundays from 5:00pm-7:00pm

Location: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

Cost: These sessions are free of charge, but there is a suggested donation of $5 that will help to cover the cost of the printing materials.

To RSVP, email us at:　 [masked]


If you have any questions, please feel free to email us.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

****NOTE*****

1.) This event is run by JCAG organizers who are following a lesson plan that is prepared in advance, so we ask that native English speakers be aware of this when participating.

2.) Due to the fact that the organizers dedicating their time to help with the event, we ask that people be considerate in terms of the time. Sessions will be cancelled in the event that students do not show up within 40 minutes of the start time.

皆様、

多くの方々のご希望や期待に応じて、我々JCAGはいよいよTOEFL (Test of English as a Foreign Language)・TOEIC (Test of English for International Communication) 対策の講座を開催致します。TOEFLは、英語圏の高等教育機関が入学希望者の外国語としての英語力を判定するための試験で、TOEICは英語によるコミュニケーション能力を検定するための試験です。


(内容)
レッスンはテスト(読解、ライティング、聴解、会話)に基づき集中したものになります。
又は発音、作文の強化等にも集中し、楽しみながら、効率的な環境でテストに励めるように指導致します。


日時と場所:


日時:日曜日の午後5時～7時 (毎週二時間単位で行います)

場所: Atrium at Citigroup Center
153 East 53rd Street (53rd Street and Lexington Avenue)
New York, NY 10022

費用: イベントのご参加は無料ですが教材の出費を緩和致しますため、$5の推奨ドネーション額をお支払い下さい。

ご予約は以下まで: （予約なしでもご参加ＯＫです）
[masked]

ご質問のある方はメールまでお問い合わせください。

皆様のお越しをお待ちしております。

results.description:
Precognition is defined as "foreknowledge of an event, especially foreknowledge of a paranormal kind." However, such foreknowledge need not be paranormal in nature. Researchers have discovered that when faced with a challenging decision, human beings make unconscious choices which become available to consciousness a good 1-10 seconds after the course of action has been selected. Here's an interesting example: http://www.wired.com/2010/11/feeling-the-future-is-precognition-possible/
More on it here: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC4141237/

Different theories offer a variety of explanations for such phenomena. One alleges that the precognitive experience itself unleashes a psychokinetic (PK) energy, the power of which then brings the envisioned future to pass. A British aeronautics engineer, J. Dunne, contends that time exists in layers upon dimensions, each of which may be viewed in different perspectives from different layers. It's possible that the same connection to Cosmic Consciousness which allows us to make better decisions in daily tasks ensuring our continued survival is responsible for easing the stress on our conscious selves by offering effortless solutions. 

The meeting place is an indoor public plaza with amenities.  Here's some info on the venue:  http://www.nyc.gov/html/dcp/html/priv/120park.shtml

I thank our member Sunny for helping facilitate this discussion. Please join in on the topic and share your input.
results.name: Let's explore the mechanism of precognition

results.description:
Please join us for Osho meditation and satsang on First and Last Sunday of every month.
Time : 5 - 7 pm
5:00 Osho Kundalini meditation
6:15 Osho video OSHO SAYS:

“You are not to do anything to be happy. In fact you have done too much to become unhappy. If you want to be unhappy, do too much. If you want to be happy, allow things, allow things to be. Rest, relax, and be in a let-go.

Let-go is the secret of life. Let –go is the secret of religion. Let-go is the greatest secret. When you are in a let-go many things, millions of things, start happening. They were already happening but you were never aware. You could not be aware; you were engaged somewhere else, you were occupied...

Where are you going? And you think that somewhere in the future there is some target to be achieved? Life is already here! Why wait for the future? Why postpone it for the future?...

For those you have attained to the here and now, the whole life starts showering flowers on them. Many things start happening which they never dreamed of. When for the first time you are really relaxed, in a meditative state, you cannot believe that life is so beautiful, so euphoric, such infinite bliss, such a sat-chit-anand; you cannot believe it! It is unbelievable...

Open the windows, break the doors open! And run out of this imprisonment, stand under the skies. Feel again! Thinking won’t help. Thinking can go on and on inside you without opening a single window. Only feeling brings you out of yourself – and you are so afraid of feeling, so much at ease with thinking and so afraid of feeling, because feeling will bring you out. It will bring you again into the very current of life. You will be in the river, moving towards the ocean.

Feel more, think less, and by and by you will see that the more you can feel, the more relaxed you are. The more you can feel, the more you become aware of the secret of life – that you need not do anything about it, you just have to be available. Just available, I say, and everything comes to you. Once the idea arises to catch hold, to cling, everything disappears.”

OSHO: Just Life That, Chapter 7

results.description:
Meet at the wooden gazebo located at the 48th St. side of the park at the lower level by the water. It's located not too far from the bathrooms near the street ramp. You can also click the location link near the meetup date & time for a Google Earth GPS view of the meetup location.

The walk will take approximately 45-60 minutes depending on how much we walk. We can walk more if the group decides to. I'll wait around 5 minutes before walking. If you're running late, post a notification and we'll wait. 

Please update your RSVP if you can't make it. We will not walk if it rains. Also, I recommend wearing sneakers to the walks. If you have any questions/comments/concerns, you can post a notification or email me through the meetup site.
results.name: Sunday Walk Around Bayonne and Rutkowski Parks

results.description:
Escapades…Views, Dancing, Music

www.EscapadesSingles.org

Washington Irving Boat Club

238 Green Street ~ Tarrytown, NY 10591 ~ <a>(914)[masked]</a>

Sunday August 30, 2015  ~  5 to 9 PM

(In case of rain, please check Escapades email or <a>[masked]</a>)

Many active & attractive singleshave enjoyed this POPULAR party place withEscapades.  It is on the Hudson River in the shadows of the Tappan Zee Bridge.  The Boat Club is known for its views of the Hudson River & magnificent sunsets.

This private club has invited Escapades to share their Tiki Bar & outdoor patio.  We’ll have an area reserved for us, while sharing the Club’s patio grill & bar.  Be sure to enjoy their reasonably-priced drinks, salads, hamburgers, & sandwiches.  If you prefer a more-formal dinner, the Sunset Cove Restaurant is at the Boat Club also; you can view their menus & press reviews online.

You’ll be an eyewitness to history & understand why President Obama visited in May 2014.  Construction is in full swing to replace the 58-year-old Tappan Zee,representing the largest loan ever awarded under the Federal Transportation Act (TIFIA).

Dance to Live Music from The Jazzman

FREE ADMISSION!  

No charge except for what you choose to eat & drink.

(We’ve enjoyed a pitcher of beer for $9 & Sausage/Peppers for $7.)

Nice casual   

Please let us know if you think you will attend.We want to reserve adequate space. 

[masked] or <a>[masked]</a>

DIRECTIONS:  FROM CONNECTICUT & WESTCHESTER:

I-95 or Merritt/Hutchinson Parkway to I-287 WEST.  After I-287 merges with I-87, go to the LAST EXIT before the Tappan Zee Bridge.  LEFT onto Route 119 to the end.  RIGHT onto Route 9 for 1 mile to Main Street.  LEFT onto Main Street and follow to the bottom of the hill.  STRAIGHT through the traffic light.  RIGHT UP THE SERVICE RAMP.  At the top of the ramp, take first LEFT.  Then again make a LEFT.  STRAIGHT to the end of the road.  Enter the Boat Club by going all the way to the left to enter their outdoor patio.

PARKING:  You may self park before or after entering the Boat Club property or proceed to Valet Parking directly in front of the Boat Club.  (Don’t pay the $10 for Yankees Park & Ride.)

By TRAIN:  Metro North to Tarrytown Station & WALK to the Boat Club.  At the Station, go to the Hudson River side of the railroad tracks.  Walk downriver toward THE BRIDGE to the last group of buildings, about ¼ mile.
results.name: Washington Irving Boat Club

Join the Uptown Gamers every other Sunday for tabletop games at the Whole Foods dining area on the Upper West Side (Located on the corner of 97th st. and Columbus Ave.). Games we generally like to bring and play are Jamaica, Resistance Avalon, King of Tokyo, 7 Wonders, Manhattan Project etc... Hope to see you there!

Comment and let us know what you'll be bringing or would like to join in on!

results.description:
The Game will be held in English

• Brain boost

• Logical reasoning

• Analytical and critical thinking skills

• Verbal fluency and public performance

• Vocabulary enrichment

• Group discussion skills

• Improvement of cognitive functions

The training program prepared by PhD and MS specialists in child psychology and linguistics, with participation of experienced "What?Where?When?" players.

Workouts are built as follows:

1. 30 minutes – intellectual exercises, created using technics of the best experts of "What-Where-When" and "Brain Ring"; the development of knowledge, memory, and intuition;

2. 20 minutes - dealing with particular types of logical problems and issues;

3. 40 minutes –intellectual team play and debriefing.

We invite everyone to register as potential Players at the future Games. We have the first 6 teams of players in place. We are looking for more. The game will go on!

"What? Where? When?" is Encyclopedia of our childhood. Everyone knows about it, everyone remembers.
results.name: August 30: "What?Where­?Wh­en?"US Children's League Game: Brain boost (10 +)

results.description:
Obicà- 24 Zagat
928 Broadway @21st Street across from Flatiron Bldg
Sunday, August 30th (limited to 34 members)
5:45 optional drinks; 6:45 dinner
$70- 4-courses, glass wine, coffee, tax, tip

There will be at least 30 members from my other dinner group, The Single Gourmet at this event.


YOUR RSVP IS NOT CONFIRMED UNLESS YOU PREPAY. pay here www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/obica/


You can not just show up and expect a seat and a meal. We prepay the restaurant, we give a guaranteed headcount, we also seat people by age range and m/f and if you just show up,  a seat will not be available for you.


Obicà, 24-Zagat, combines Italy’s finest artisanal ingredients with innovative presentations. Founded in Rome in 2004, Obicà means “Here we are” for their open kitchen concept. Known for presenting traditional Italian dishes in a clear and contemporary way, Obicà has expanded worldwide with twenty locations in Italy, England, Dubai, Japan, and the United States. In 2013, the restaurant partnered with “Slow Food Association” to commit to food linked with pleasure, culture, tradition and a style of life. Obicà uses mozzarella only made from the creamy and nutritious milk of the water buffalo, hand made by artisan producers in the Denominazione di Origine Protetta of Campania in Southern Italy and flown in to NYC. Our Italian 4-course meal will include-

OBICA STARERS

(Served to Share)

Prosciutto Crudo di Parma

Salame Felino

Mozzarella di Bufala

Mozzarella di Bufala Affumicata

Pomodorini Datterini e Pesto

Carciofini

&

Pizza Pomodoro Biologico e Mozzarella

MID COURSE

Parmigiana di Melanzane

Grilled Eggplant, Mozzarella di Bufala, Tomato Sauce, Basil Parmigiana Reggiano

Burrata

Heirloom Tomatoes, Black Olives Soncino

Mache, Wild Arugula, Radicchio, Avocado, Almonds, Lemon Dressing

MAIN COURSE

Pappardelle al Ragù di Anatra e Arancia

Homemade Rosemary Pasta with Hudson Valley Duck Tuscan Style Ragu, Orange Zest

Filetto Bardato

Nebraska Grass-Fed Beef, Almonds, Smashed Potatoes with Fresh Rosemary

Risotto con Scampi e Asparagi

Aged Acquerello Rice from Italy, Shrimp, Marinated Raw Scampi, Asparagus, Lemon Parsley Gremolada

DESSERT

Torta di Capri

Flourless Chocolate and Almond Cake, Fior di Latte Ice Cream

Tiramisù

Traditional Recipe

*Includes One Glass of House Red or White Wine Per Person

American Coffee

Justin

results.description:
OUTDOOR PARTY: Sunday Fun Day Generation Party

Location 52-10 Center Blvd,New York,New York 11101 Venue LIC Landing Time 6:00 PM - 10:00 PM Price $5 Pre-Sale | Adults: $10 - $15 Online, $25 @ the door | Kids: $7 Online, $10 @ the door
Ready for another round of Sunday Fun Day? Quiet Events presents another huge outdoor party at one of the best spots in NYC.

From 6pm-10pm, 3 DJs will be spinning music from all generations so all partiers have something they know and love to dance to.

DJ Blue – 50s/60s/70s

DJ Red – 80s/90s/2k

DJ Green – Dance-Pop/Hip-Hop/Top 40s

Not only will you have 3 different types of music to dance to, you’ll also have the chance to enjoy a spectacular view of the Manhattan skyline and party at sunset – what better way to end the weekend?

Food and drinks will be available at the venue – LIC Landing by COFFEED is a waterfront restaurant that donates 10% of its gross revenue to support the Hunters Point Parks Conservancy – providing fresh coffee, house-brewed teas as well as a wide selection of gourmet sandwiches, amazing burgers and hot dogs to enjoy overlooking the beautiful NYC skyline.

Get Your Tickets Here: http://quietevents.electrostub.com/event.cfm?cart&id=151991

Party open to ALL Ages / Must be 21+ to Drink.

***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.

If you haven’t had a chance to join us for past Sunday Fun Days, check out what you missed and make sure to be there this time! Get your discounted online tickets ASAP!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HmFLSpLOXvo

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: We have the permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine

(Leader- Ray Ray)

(co-leader- Manny D.)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME - 5.45PM!! 

• Game starts at 6pm sharp .

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

<a href="http://www.playsoccer2give.com/games/refund-request"></a> If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
Party at sunset and under the stars with an incredible view of the Midtown Manhattan skyline at LIC Landing, one of NYC’s most spectacular venues - where elegance meets nightlife. 

We're taking the word “party” to a whole new level by moving the club outdoors! Think music festival on the waterfront, under the stars with the most amazing view of NYC.   

You will receive special wireless headphones that will allow you to choose from 3 top DJs spinning on one main stage – with some amazing surprises and giveaways too!

Prepay Only Event for this group. Ticket prices start at $15 and will go up to $25 as event gets closer. GET TIX HERE -http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/sundayfunday/

Not only will you have 3 different types of music to dance to, you’ll also have the chance to enjoy a spectacular view of the Manhattan skyline and party at sunset – what better way to end the weekend? 

Delicious Drinks & Amazing Food available for purchase. LIC Landing is a brand-new waterfront park, next to the East River Ferry terminal. 18+ to party, 21+ to Drink. Rain or Shine Event. 

GET TICKETS HERE (Prepay Only Event) -http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/sundayfunday/

results.description:
Party at sunset and under the stars with an incredible view of the Midtown Manhattan skyline at LIC Landing, one of NYC’s most spectacular venues - where elegance meets nightlife. 

We're taking the word “party” to a whole new level by moving the club outdoors! Think music festival on the waterfront, under the stars with the most amazing view of NYC.   

You will receive special wireless headphones that will allow you to choose from 3 top DJs spinning on one main stage – with some amazing surprises and giveaways too!

Prepay Only Event for this group. Ticket prices start at $15 and will go up to $25 as event gets closer. GET TIX HERE -http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/sundayfunday/

Not only will you have 3 different types of music to dance to, you’ll also have the chance to enjoy a spectacular view of the Manhattan skyline and party at sunset – what better way to end the weekend? 

Delicious Drinks & Amazing Food available for purchase. LIC Landing is a brand-new waterfront park, next to the East River Ferry terminal. 18+ to party, 21+ to Drink. Rain or Shine Event. 

GET TICKETS HERE (Prepay Only Event) -http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/sundayfunday/

results.how_to_find_us: Play by ear
results.name: Football Funday

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 6:15pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:30pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>; for a refund.

There is a minimum of 3v3 with 6 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

[masked]
results.name: Sunday 6:15pm Indoor Soccer @ W86th (1.5 hours 4v4) for Roundstar Foundation

group.name: PS2G NYC-Coed Soccer Pickup for Charity -Play Soccer 2 Give

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.how_to_find_us: $5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink

Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

Many of us want to do something truly meaningful with our lives. This desire is a God-given one as He has a unique calling and purpose for each person. Join us this Sunday as the Associate Director of the Brooklyn Ark, Renata Lee, explores the life of King David (the second king of Israel), and how he began walking in God's calling for his life. Leave feeling inspired and encouraged in the calling upon your life!


Welcome to the Brooklyn Ark’s main weekly event—our Sunday Gathering (6:30-8:30pm at 48 Wall Street—5th Floor). If you are looking for a church, synagogue, or space to wrestle with big questions, this is your place. We invite you to plug into the Brooklyn Ark Community this Sunday, and experience the authentic community and intelligent Bible teaching you've been looking for. 

Community

The Brooklyn Ark is made up of people that are getting to know and care about each other. We are making the Big City smaller - one relationship at a time.

Culture

The Brooklyn Ark deeply supports the creative expression of truth through music, poetry & visual arts.  You will discover that we cultivate an art-friendly atmosphere.

Faith

We curiously read and discuss the Bible (Hebrew & Greek Scriptures), asking questions, seeking out answers, and trying to find practical application for our lives. 

Learn more about the Brooklyn Ark: http://www.brooklynark.com/

results.description:
"Tuning the mind, body, and soul"-Gaynor

The sound and silence meditation group meets every Sunday. The meditation begins with 30 min. of  toning*, 30 minutes of silent meditation, In the last 10 min. there is time for a brief discussion, questions, or sharing.


According to Gaynor (1999, p. [masked]), "Sounds enters the healing equation from several different directions: It may alter cellular functions through energetic effects; it may entrain biological systems to function more homeostatically; it may becalm the mind and therefore the body; or it may have emotional effects, which influence neurotransmitters and neuropeptides, which in turn help regulate the immune system-the healer within. Music is organized sound that has potent emotional effects and stimulates memories, associations, and highly developed  psychological states with clear impact on our healing systems."

 Toning* in your own voice is a very powerful tool for self-healing, relaxation, personal growth, opening creativity, and helping to balance life experiences.Toning is the elongation of a note or tone using breath and voice to assist you to get still enough to meditate.
It is great.....
• If you have a difficult time getting still enough to meditate;
• If you desire higher states of consciousness;
• If your communication energy center seems blocked;
• If you breathe too shallowly;
• If you need immediate grief or stress relief;
• If you're depressed;
• If you need more confidence or zest;
• If you have trouble listening, focusing or being in the moment

We look forward to seeing you at the next scheduled meet-up!Please e-mail me at [masked] if you have any questions or concerns.

results.description:
The novel is presented as a 999-line poem titled "Pale Fire", written by the fictional John Shade, with a foreword and lengthy commentary by a neighbor and academic colleague of the poet, Charles Kinbote . Together these elements form a narrative in which both authors are central characters. 

Pale Fire has spawned a wide variety of interpretations and a large body of written criticism, which Pekka Tammi estimated in 1995 as over 80 studies.[1]

The Nabokov authority  Brian Boyd has called it "Nabokov's most perfect novel", [2] and the critic Harold Bloom called it "the surest demonstration of his own genius ... that remarkable tour de force".[3]

It was ranked at number 53 on the list of the Modern Library 100 Best Novels and number 1 onLarry McCaffery's 20th Century’s Greatest Hits: 100 English-Language Books of Fiction

.
results.name: "Pale Fire" by Vladimir Nabokov

Teams are 7v7, 90min+ game. 2 or 3 teams (depending on final numbers). We rotate every 10 min games. Arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt.


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Pass the ball have fun.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal. Goals are 6' x 18'.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
